January 25, 2015)   Spring Semester 2015 (January 26, 2015 - May 21, 2015)   Summer Session 2014 (May 27 - September 2, 2014)     Contents       Access to Bobst Library   Access to Other Libraries for Members of the NYU Community   Access to Other NYU Libraries   Questions?          Access to Bobst Library   Library Privileges Guide   User access privileges for NYU and Consortium libraries.     Visitors requesting access to Bobst Library     • NYU faculty, matriculating students, and full-time staff with valid NYU ID have access to Bobst Library. - Faculty and Administrator Circulation Privileges - Student and Full-time Staff Circulation Privileges • Faculty and matriculating students of Consortium and Affiliated Institutions have access and borrowing privileges at Bobst Library • Faculty, students, and professional staff of SHARES member institutions , outside the metropolitan region have access privileges to Bobst Library.   • Faculty, students, and staff of Columbia University have access privileges to Bobst Library. Columbia University Reciprocal Agreement     • NYU Alumni with a valid NYU Alumni Card are entitled to one visit to Bobst Library   • Alumni and Community Members can join Friends of Bobst Library to gain access to Bobst at various membership levels     • NYU departments may sponsor access for guests, visitors, or temporary affiliates • Visiting Faculty from universities outside the metropolitan area, upon presentation of valid identification, will be granted one-day courtesy reading privileges.     • For more extended services, researchers may register in advance for a New York Public Library Access card , which enables them to use the world-class research collections at the New York Public Library .   • If a particular item is not available in either the "home" library or the public library systems, a METRO library may issue a yellow METRO Title Referral card, which will allow an individual a one-time only visit to a library to use the specified item.        A ccess to Other Libraries for Members of the NYU Community   • Consortium and Affiliated Libraries • New York Metropolitan Area libraries (METRO) • Columbia University Reciprocal Agreement • SHARES member libraries • New York Public Library - For more extended services, researchers may register in advance for a New York Public Library Access card , which enables them to use the world-class research collections at the New York Public Library. • MaRLI: Manhattan Research Library Initiative -MaRLI is available to Full-time faculty members and doctoral students from all New York University Schools and Colleges. To register for MaRLI as an NYU scholar, please go here .          Access to Other NYU Libraries     • See NYU Library Locations for contacts at other NYU Libraries, including the Courant Institute, Real Estate, Kevorkian, Fine Art, Law, Medical, Dental, and La Pietra libraries.       Questions?   Contact the Library Privileges service window during our scheduled hours at 212-998-2550, or use our Library Access Questions form to submit your question online.                      News           Earth Week Films at Bobst   Reserve a group or individual study room   Setting Google Scholar Preferences for NYU Materials   Configure your laptop for wireless! Wagner Graduate School of Public Service      School of Continuing and Professional Studies      School of Law      School of Medicine      Silver School of Social Work      Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development      Tisch School of the Arts                                                        go                                                    New York University              New York University              Information Technology Services                                                  About ITS                               Get Connected                             Your NetID & Password                          IT Service Catalog                          Connect On-Campus                           Connect Off-Campus                             NYU VPN                          NYU-NET Proxy                                    Connect at the Global Sites                          NYU Smart Phones & Mobile Devices                          Software                          ITS Accounts                                           Communicate & Collaborate                               Help & Support                                 Computer Security                               Instruction & Research                               Locations & Facilities                                                                         Home           //        Get Connected                 //        Connect Off-Campus                 //         NYU VPN                                      NYU VPN                                          search the site                                                                        did you know?           ITS recommends that you run VPN whenever you connect from a remote location to NYU services that involve sensitive data.                  VPN (Virtual Private Network) is software that provides password-protected access to NYU's network (NYU-NET) and Internet services when you are connecting from off-campus. It is as secure as when you are connected directly to NYU-NET on campus. VPN is required to access some secure NYU services when using a computer outside NYU-NET.      Eligibility   NYU Services That Require VPN   Installing & Using VPN   VPN Support & Troubleshooting      Eligibility   Only current, full-time staff, faculty, and degree students are able to use the VPN service. An active NYU NetID and password are required to both download and use VPN software.     Non-degree students and alumni will not be able to authenticate using VPN.    NYU Services That Require VPN   ITS recommends that you run VPN whenever you connect from a remote location to NYU services that involve sensitive data, but the services below require the use of VPN to successfully connect to them from outside of NYU-NET. Please note: This is a partial list; other NYU services may require a VPN connection.     NYU myTime   PeopleSoft SIS -- Admin  Webspace   FTP to most NYU web servers     Installing & Using VPN   You can find detailed instructions on downloading, configuring, and connecting via VPN in the ServiceLink knowledge base:     Installing and using VPN on a Macintosh computer   Installing and using VPN on a Windows computer   Installing and using VPN on an Android device   Installing and using VPN on an iPhone   Installing and using VPN on an iPad      VPN Support & Troubleshooting   If you have any questions regarding the installation, configuration, or use of NYU VPN, search the ServiceLink knowledge base .   If you are unable to find a solution to your issue, please contact the IT Service Desk at AskITS@nyu.edu or, in New York, at 212-998-3333. For more information on contacting the Service Desk at all NYU locations, please see nyu.edu/its/askits/helpdesk .    Page last reviewed: March 10, 2014

As part of our alumni community of almost 470,000, you are eligible for discounts on entertainment, dining, travel, transportation, shopping, financial services, insurance, and more. You can also access alumni resources including the eLibrary, Wasserman Career Center, and are eligible for an NYU email address for life. Alumni Cards were mailed to US addresses in September 2014. If you didn't receive your card, be sure to update your address to be included in the next mailing later this year. Your Card gives you access to local discounts and will allow you to show your Violet Pride, but you don’t have to wait to start taking advantage of the new program!       Please note, the Alumni Card is not a University ID and may not be used to access University buildings except where specified.      Get Started        Activate your NetID at start.nyu.edu     Log into NYUHome at home.nyu.edu/alumni     Click on NYU Alumni Card: PerksConnect     Browse the great deals and discounts       Need help? Check out these detailed instructions for activating your NetID and logging into NYUHome. For technical support, please contact the IT Service Desk on 212-998-3333 or AskITS@nyu.edu .       Benefits Overview    These are some of the discounts and deals that you'll find when you log in and access your Alumni Card online. New deals are available daily, so be sure to check back often!       Travel & Transportation        Alumni Travel Programs     Hotel Discounts*     Avis Rental Car Discounts*     NYC Parking Discounts*     Travel Insurance       Shopping & Consumer Discounts        NYU Bookstore Discounts       Financial Services & Insurance        NYU Credit Cards     Automotive Insurance     Homeowner and Renter Insurance     Group Life Insurance     Health Insurance Mart     Travel Insurance     Pet Insurance     Mortgages (through NYU Federal Credit Union)     Car Loans (through NYU Federal Credit Union)         Home Financing Solutions and Wealth Management Services             Alumni Services        Wasserman Center Career Counseling     School of Professional Studies Course Discount         Alumni e-Library *         Lifetime Email     Discounted Alumni Memberships to Bobst Library           Club and Society Memberships        Hudson Union Society*         NYU Club at the Princeton Club*     The Torch Club*           Entertainment & Dining        Discounted Tickets for the NYU Skirball Center for the Performing Arts*     Discounted Tickets at NYU Ticket Central*     Stand Up NY Comedy Club     Turtle Cove Golf Center     The Town Hall       *Login to NYUHome required to access.          For any questions about alumni benefits, please contact Alumni Relations at alumni.info@nyu.edu or (212) 998-6912.                                            Log Into NYU Home to    Access Your Alumni Card Online    Log into NYU Home and click on the NYU Alumni Card: PerksConnect link to access a wide variety of discounts and services exclusively for NYU alumni. Never logged in to NYU Home? No problem! Just follow the simple instructions to the left to get started.    Log Into NYU Home               Sign Up Here      to Receive Your Alumni Card       Your NYU Alumni Card was mailed to your US address in September; if you didn't receive it, be sure to fill out this form to be included in the next mailing. With your physical card, you can take advantage of local discounts and show your Violet Pride.       Live outside of the US? Be sure to let us know you would like to receive a card in the mail by opting in and updating your mailing address .                   New Alumni Benefit:   Discounted Classes at the School of Professional Studies      As an alumnus/a of NYU, the School of Professional Studies is pleased to offer you a 20% discount when you enroll in its noncredit courses. Choose from a broad array of professionally focused programs that enhance your current skill set, provide focus in an area of specialty, or prepare you for a new career path. For more information, visit sps.nyu.edu/ce or call 212-998-7150.    Learn More                     Congratulations   Class of 2014!       Learn more about the benefits and services available to new grads.    Read More                      Alumni Gym Membership   at Coles or Palladium      Interested in a gym membership at Coles or Palladium? Visit the NYU Athletics site for membership fee information and membership office hours.    Learn More                     Have a question?      Contact Us!       If you have a question for the NYU Office of Alumni Relations , please contact us at alumni.info@nyu.edu or call 212-998-6912.
